greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions to the equation p^k - p^(k-1) = n, where k is a positive integer and p is prime.
comment: The Euler phi function A000010 (number of integers less than n which are coprime with n) involves calculating the expression p^(k-1)*(p-1), where p is prime. For example phi(120) = phi(2^3*3*5) = (2^3-2^2)*(3-1)*(5-1) = 4*2*4 = 32.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
example: Notice that it is not possible to have more than 2 solutions, but say when n=4 there are two solutions, namely 5^1 - 5^0 and 2^3 - 2^2.
program: (PARI) lista(N=100) = {tab = vector(N); for (i=1, N, p = prime(i); for (j=1, N, v = p^j-p^(j-1); if (v <= #tab, tab[v]++););); for (i=1, #tab, print1(tab[i], ", "));} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 06 2013
results.author: _Anthony C Robin_, Jan 15 2008
